body: Deficiency in what vitamin leads to pellagra?

Identify all of the following4 conditions that would result in a Bohr shift of the hemoglobin-oxygen dissociation curve: I) Increased partial pressure of $\athrm{CO}_{2}$ II) Increased partial pressure of $\athrm{O}_{2}$ III) Increased concentration of2,3 BPG in the blood IV) Increased concentration of lactic acid in the blood
Which of the following compounds would cause the greatest boiling point elevation when added to water?
Order the following4 elements in terms of increasing first electron affinity:1) Oxygen2) Lithium3) Boron4) Sodium
Occasionally, two separate crystals in a mineral can grow in such a way that they intersect each other and share a crystallographic plane. What is the name of this phenomenon?
Which of the following radioactive isotopes would be most appropriate for dating a sample of age140 million years?
Which of the following reasons best describes why birds are able to sit on a power line without being electrocuted, while humans can die from standing on the ground near a lightning strike?

choices.W: The outer coating of power lines protects the birds' feet, but there is no protective coating on the ground
choices.X: Humans are much less resistive than birds, causing more current to flow through them
choices.Y: The ground has a much higher resistance than a power line, causing a greater voltage difference per unit distance
choices.Z: The ground the human is standing on is grounded, leading to a greater voltage difference between the human and the ground

body: Consider a system of levers where a lever of length4 meters is connected to the left side of a lever of length7 meters. If the system has an efficiency of80%, what is the output torque measured at the far right side if an input torque of40 Newton-meters is applied?

Identical volumes of two solutions, A and B, are prepared. Solution A is made of pure water and Solution B is made of0.5 Molar $\athrm{NaHCO_3}$ . Which of the following statements about the solutions is true?

choices.W: A has a higher vapor pressure and B has a higher boiling point
choices.X: B has a higher vapor pressure and A has a higher boiling point
choices.Y: A has a higher vapor pressure and boiling point
choices.Z: B has a higher vapor pressure and boiling point

answer: W) A has a higher vapor pressure and B has a higher boiling point

body: Order the following4 atoms by increasing number of neutrons:1) Technetium2) Platinum3) Tungsten4) Silver
Enloe Science Bowl needs to select new board members for their2022-2023 season. If there are15 ways they can choose a2 person board, how many different ways can they select a3 person board?
Providing your answer in base8, add the following numbers in different bases [READ AS DIGITS]:101011 in base2,221 in base4,14 in base8, A in base16?
Which of the following changes would increase the number of electrons being emitted from a metal due to an incident light source?

choices.W: Increasing the frequency of the light source
choices.X: Decreasing the frequency of the light source
choices.Y: Making the light waves travel in phase with each other
choices.Z: Increasing the intensity of the light

answer: Z) Increasing the intensity of the light

body: Vedang is riding a bike at a constant speed of7.4 m/s while he pedals with a power of200 Watts. If the wheels of the bike are changed to be1.5 times larger in diameter while Vedang pedals with the same power, what is the new speed of the bike in meters per second?

Researchers at the Office of Fossil Energy are studying ways to improve the transportation of liquified natural gas. What is the term for the process of converting liquified natural gas back to its gaseous state?

Researchers at the Office of Fossil Energy are studying ways to improve the processing of natural gas. If the first step in a purification process has an activation energy of830 kJ, what is the natural log of the ratio between the reaction rate constants at800 Kelvin and400 Kelvin?
Emission and absorption spectra provide evidence for all except which of the following?

choices.X: The Bohr model of the atom
choices.Y: A universally constant speed of light

answer: Y) A universally constant speed of light

body: Order the following4 gaseous molecules from highest to lowest velocity at273 Kelvin:1) Ammonia2) Nitrogen3) Oxygen4) Carbon monoxide
Which of the following minerals has the fewest planes of cleavage?
Which of the following rocks displays compositional layering?
The contraction of muscles in the human body is stimulated by the release of what ion?
Cyclic electron flow in photosynthesis excludes what photosystem and serves to primarily produce what substance, respectively?
A tetrahedron of volume1 is removed from each vertex of a tetrahedron of volume17. How many edges does the new solid have?

A Pythagorean Quadruple is a set of4 numbers a, b, c, d, such that $a^2 + b^2 + c^2 = d^2$ [READ: a squared plus b squared plus c squared equals d squared]. Identify all of the following3 sets of numbers that will form a Pythagorean Quadruple. I) (3,4,12,13) II) (6,10,15,17) III) (8,9,12,17)
Which of the following is true of the frequency of a damped spring system compared to an undamped one with the same spring constant and mass?

choices.Z: It depends on the value of the spring constant

body: A regular hexagonal prism is laying on its side on an inclined plane with a very high coefficient of friction. Which of the following is closest to the incline angle needed for the heptagonal prism to begin to roll?
Which of the following best explains why the Moon is red on a lunar eclipse?

choices.W: Neutrinos traveling through the Earth illuminate the moon at low frequencies
choices.X: Red light gets refracted at the largest angle by the Earth's atmosphere to illuminate the moon.
choices.Y: Blue light gets absorbed by the Earth's oceans preventing it from reaching the moon
choices.Z: Blue light gets scattered by the Earth's atmosphere to the greatest degree, preventing it from reaching the moon.

body: In which of the following regions of the electromagnetic spectrum does the sun emit the largest amount of energy?
The circumcenter of an equilateral triangle is3 units above its bases. Which of the following is the area of the equilateral triangle?
Identify all of the following four numbers in base13 that are divisible by4 [READ DIGITS INDIVIDUALLY]: I) B36 II)259 III)435
Which of the following is not a requirement of Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium?
Which of the following DNA repair pathways would be used to repair pyrimidine [pi-ri-mid-ee] dimers?

Researchers at the Brookhaven National Laboratory are studying the ways that plant seeds get energy from the endosperm. One of these ways includes synthesizing sugars from lipids, and occurs in a specialized version of a peroxisome. What is the name of this anabolic pathway?

Scientists at SLAC National Accelerator Facility are leading the creation of new laser technologies. So far, they have succeeded in producing lasers that emit highly cohesive radiation as well as lasers that emit very short pulses of strong radiation, but have not been able to create a laser that accomplishes both of these. What scientific principle is preventing them from making advancements towards this?
Impedance is a combination of what two electrical quantities?
What is the magnitude of the impedance of a circuit with resistance of7 ohms, capacitance reactance of30 ohms, and inductive reactance of6 ohms?
Thanush has a list of eight integers. He calculates the average of the numbers, and rounds his answer to the nearest tenth. Which one of the following values could not possibly be his result?
Which of the following operations between two numbers a and b is commutative?

choices.W: a / (b + a) [READ: a divided by the quantity of b plus a]
choices.Y: (a + b)² + (a - b)² [READ: open parenthesis a plus b close parentheses squared plus open parentheses a minus b close parentheses squared]
choices.Z: ln(a/b) [READ: natural log of open parenthesis a divided by b close parenthesis]

body: Identify all of the following3 hormones that are produced by the anterior pituitary [pit-oo-i-tar-ee] gland: I) Oxytocin II) Luteinizing [loo-tee-in-izing] Hormone III) Antidiuretic [anti-di-yur-etic] Hormone
Which of the following incorrectly matches a glial cell with its function?

choices.Z: Schwann cells - myelinate peripheral nervous system

answer: Y) Astrocytes - myelinate central nervous system

body: Researchers in Anirudh's basement are studying the digestive tracts of various mammals. Which of the following statements is not true of digestive systems in relation to dietary preference?

choices.W: Frugivores tend to have larger intestinal surface areas
choices.X: Carnivores tend to have shorter intestines
choices.Y: Herbivores tend to have multiple stomachs to process fiber
choices.Z: Omnivores tend to eat more animal than plant matter.

answer: Z) Omnivores tend to eat more animal than plant matter.

body: Researchers at Sandia National Labs are studying the ways that semiconducting materials can be improved. What is the name of the positive charge carrier in a doped semiconductor which represents the absence of an electron?
What term describes a solution that rotates the polarization angle of light that travels through it?
Identify all of the following3 terms that are used to describe types of metal alloys: I) Smectic II) Interstitial III) Substitutional
In which of the following areas on the H-R diagram would you find Delta Cephei?
Which of the following best describes a single degenerate progenitor [pro-jen-i-tor] supernova?

choices.W: Type1A supernova involving a white dwarf and a larger star
choices.X: Type1B supernova involving a single massive star
choices.Y: Type1A supernova involving two white dwarfs
choices.Z: Type1B supernova involving a single white dwarf
